Obtaining the Confidence of Patients 

     You are too reticent. It is in your power to bind the sick to your heart, and if you do not obtain the confidence of your 
                                                                           148
patients, it is because you do not see the great need of tact, ingenuity, in ministering to the soul as well as to the body. I do not justify anyone in practicing deception upon the dying. In as mild a manner as possible tell them the truth in regard to their case (as I believe you do), and then point them to Jesus as their only hope.
